greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of f(x, x) * f(x^7, x^11) in powers of x where f(, ) is Ramanujan's general theta function.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Euler transform of a period 36 sequence.
G.f.: (Sum_{k in Z} x^k^2) * (Sum_{k in Z} x^(9*k^2 + 2*k)).
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 0, 0, DivisorSum[ 9 n + 1, KroneckerSymbol[ -4, #] &]];
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, x] QPochhammer[ -x^7, x^18] QPochhammer[ -x^11, x^18] QPochhammer[ x^18], {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, sumdiv(9*n + 1, d, kronecker(-4, d)))};
(PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, my(m = 9*n + 1, k, s); forstep(j=0, sqrtint(m), 3, if( issquare(m - j^2, &k) && (k%9 == 1 || k%9 == 8), s+=(j>0)+1)); s)};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jan 26 2017
